keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_TOOLTIP_BR: Break out of the containing loop.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_TOOLTIP_CO: Skip the rest of this loop, and continue with the next iteration.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_TOOLTIP_WHILE: While the condition is true, then do the statements.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_TOOLTIP_UNTIL: While the condition is false, then do the statements.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BLOCK_DESCRIPTION: This instruction adds a comment on the generated code as well as encansulates the code inside the container (generated code include brackets that might be usefull to create different contexts for variables). Also, if you collapse the block instruction, will appear just the comment and the remainder of blocks will be occluded, but it does not affect to the code generation, and thus it is usefull to generate compact Facilino code.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BLOCK_TOOLTIP: Creates a block of instructions. This can be used to duplicate a set of instructions or to collapse them into a one single instruction to avoid cluttering.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_COMMENT_TOOLTIP: Creates a comment on the generated code. It does not affect to the compilation/execution of the code.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_COMMENT_NAME: Create a comment in Arduino code
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_COMMENT_DESCRIPTION: This instruction adds a comment on the generated code. This is useful to document your generated code. It is possible to add also comments on block instructions by right-clicking on the instruction and selecting the 'Add comment' option.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IGNORE_DESCRIPTION: This instructions produces the code to evaluate its input, but the result is ignored.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IGNORE_TOOLTIP: This instructions produces the code to evaluate its input, but the result is ignored.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_COMPARE_DESCRIPTION: Evaluates the relationship between two 'entities' to discriminate whether they are equal; different; smaller than; less than or equal to; greater than or greater than or equal to or greater. The entities to be related can be integers, decimals, binary values, characters, etc ... (they could also be more complex objects). Returns true or false.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_COMPARE_DROPDOWN_OPERATOR: Operator: Relational operator to use: equal; different; smaller than; less than or equal to; greater than or greater than or equal to or greater.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP: Checks if both inputs are equal, different, smaller than, etc...
keys.LANG_LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_EQ: Checks if both inputs are equal.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_NEQ: Checks if both inputs are different.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_LT: Checks if the first input is smaller than the second one.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_LTE: Checks if the first input is smaller than or equal to the second one.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_GT: Checks if the first input is greater than the second one.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_GTE: Checks if the first input is greater than or equal to the second one.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_OPERATION_DESCRIPTION: It evaluates the inputs and returns true or false depending on the selected logic operator (AND, OR, XOR, XNOR or LOGICAL IMPLICATION).
keys.LANG_LOGIC_OPERATION_INPUT_A: A: Logical value to be evaluated.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_OPERATION_INPUT_B: B: Logical value to be evaluated.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP: Check if both inputs satisfy a binary operation
keys.LANG_LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP_AND: Checks if both inputs are true.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP_OR: Checks if either inputs are true.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_OPERATION_NAME: Bitwise AND, OR or XOR operation
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_OPERATION_DESCRIPTION: This instruction performs a bitwise operation between two numbers. You can select an AND, OR or XOR operation.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_OPERATION_INPUT_A: A: First number to perform the bitwise operation (it means that the logic operation is on each of the bits of the numbers, one against the other).
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_OPERATION_INPUT_B: B: Second number to perform the bitwise operation (it means that the logic operation is on each of the bits of the numbers, one against the other).
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_OPERATION_DROPDOWN_OP: Operator: Bitwise operation can be AND (&), OR (|) or XOR (^).
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_OPERATION_TOOLTIP: Bitwise AND (&), OR (|) or XOR (^) operation.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_NOT_DESCRIPTION: This instruction performs a bitwise not on a number (negates each of the bit of the number).
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_NOT_OUTPUT: Returns a number with the resulting negation operation.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_SHIFT_DESCRIPTION: This instruction performs a bitwise shift of the given amount of bits on a number. Shifting a number is equivalent to multiply the number by 2^n, being n the number of number of bits to shift.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_SHIFT_INPUT_B: Second operand: Amount of bits to shift.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_SHIFT_OUTPUT: Returns a number with the resulting shifting operation.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_SHIFT_TOOLTIP: Bitwise shift to the LEFT (<<) or to the RIGHT (>>).
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE8_NAME: Combines two bytes into a 16-bit number
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE8_DESCRIPTION: This instruction combines two bytes into a 16-bit number by assigning the 8-bit most significat bits to the first number and the 8-bit least significant bits to the second number.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE8_INPUTS: Numbers: The first number is assigned to the most signficant bits and the second number to the least significant bits.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE8_OUTPUT: Returns a 16-bit number with the resulting operation.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE8_TOOLTIP: Combines byte numbers in a two-byte number containing the upper and the lower bytes.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE16_NAME: Combines two 16-bits numbers into a 32-bit number
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE16_DESCRIPTION: This instruction combines two 16-bits numbers into a 32-bit number by assigning the 16-bit most significat bits to the first number and the 16-bit least significant bits to the second number.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE16_INPUTS: Numbers: The first number is assigned to the most signficant bits and the second number to the least significant bits.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE16_OUTPUT: Returns a 32-bit number with the resulting operation.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE16_TOOLTIP: Combines short int numbers (two-byte numbers) in a single long int number (four-byte number) containing the upper and the lower words.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE8x4_NAME: Combines four bytes into a 32-bit number
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE8x4_DESCRIPTIO: This instruction combines four bytes into a 32-bit number by assigning the 8-bit most significat bits to the first number, the 8-bit least significant bits to the fourth number.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE8x4_INPUTS: The first number is assigned to the most signficant bits and the fourth number to the least significant bits.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE8x4_OUTPUT: Returns a 32-bit number with the resulting operation.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BITWISE_COMBINE8x4_TOOLTIP: Combines byte numbers in a four-byte number (32-bit number).
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP: Performs floating point operations on numbers
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_ROOT: Returns the square root of a number.
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_ABS: Returns the absolute value of a number.
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_NEG: Returns the negation of a number.
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_LN: Returns the natural logarithm of a number.
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_LOG10: Returns the base 10 logarithm of a number.
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_EXP: Returns e to the power of a number.
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_POW10: Returns 10 to the power of a number.
keys.LANG_MATH_ARITHMETIC_DESCRIPTION: Performs the arithmetic operation (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division or power) specified by the operator.
keys.LANG_MATH_ARITHMETIC_DROPDOWN_OPERATOR: Operator: Arithmetic operator to evaluate (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division or power).
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_SETUP_LOOP_DESCRIPTION: This instruction must be in every Arduino program and in fact is included by default when starting a new code. It allows to include instructions that will be executed at startup (only during startup) and instructions that will be repeated indefinitely (at the end of the last instruction it starts to execute the first instruction again).
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_SETUP_LOOP_STATEMENT_SETUP: Setup: set of instructions that are only executed once (at startup).
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_SETUP_LOOP_STATEMENT_LOOP: Loop: set of instructions that are executed repeatedly.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_SETUP_LOOP_TOOLTIP: Blocks in setup will be executed at start, and blocks in Loop will be repeated continuously.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_SETUP_LOOP_OTA_TOOLTIP: Blocks in setup will be exectued at start, and blocks in Loop will be repeated continuously. This block is used to upload code wirelessly using Facilino OTA Web Server. Please, let the Loop section to be exectued continuoustly, since OTA Web service needs to be checks periodically.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_DEFNORETURN_PROCEDURE_DE: Implements a function that has no return value. The code to execute in the function must be stacked inside the statement. The function can have multiple input arguments (and of different types) using the mutator (top left icon).
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_DEFNORETURN_PROCEDURE_MU: Allows you to create input parameters of the function. Add as many variables as needed, specify their name and type of variable.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_DEFNORETURN_PROCEDURE_ST: Do: Instructions to execute within the function.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_DEFNORETURN_TOOLTIP: A function with no return value.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_DEFRETURN_PROCEDURE_DESC: Implements the call of a function that has a return value. The code to execute in the function must be stacked inside the statement. The function can have multiple input arguments (and of different types) using the mutator (top left icon).
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_DEFRETURN_PROCEDURE_MUTA: Execute: Instructions to execute within the function.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_DEFRETURN_PROCEDURE_STAT: Execute: Instructions to execute within the function.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_RETURN_DESCRIPTION: Returns a value (leaves the function returning the indicated value).
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_DEFRETURN_TOOLTIP: A function with a return value.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_CALLNORETURN_DESCRIPTION: It makes a call to a function that has no return (which returns no value). If the function has input arguments, these can be passed to the function with the input connectors of the instruction itself.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_CALLNORETURN_DROPDOWN_FU: Function: Name of the function to call.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_CALLNORETURN_TOOLTIP: Calls a function with no return value.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_CALLRETURN_DESCRIPTION: Performs a call to a function that has a return value returned at the output connector. If the function has input arguments, these can be passed to the function with the input connectors of the instruction itself.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_CALLRETURN_DROPDOWN_FUNC: Function: Name of the function to call.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_CALLRETURN_TOOLTIP: Calls a function with a return value.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_IF_RETURN_DESCRIPTION: If the condition is true then it returns a value (leaves the function returning the indicated value)
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_IF_RETURN_INPUT_IF: If: Evaluates whether the condition is true.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IF_MSG_IF_NAME: If ... execute ..., else if ... execute, otherwise execute ...
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IF_MSG_IF_DESCRIPTION: Executes a set of instructions if a condition is met. Additional conditions may be generated subject to the preconditions not being met ('else if'), each with its set of instructions to execute. In addition, in case none of the previous conditions have been fulfilled, a set of instructions can be executed by default ('else').
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IF_MSG_IF_STATEMENTS_DO: Do: Set of instructions to execute conditionally.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IF_MSG_IF_MUTATOR_DESC: It allows to add other conditions to evaluate 'else if' or 'else'.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IF_MSG_IF_INPUTS_CONDITION: If condition: If true, the stacked instructions associated with the condition are executed.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_IFRETURN_TOOLTIP: If the condition is true, then returns this value.
keys.LANG_PROCEDURES_IFRETURN_WARNING: Warning: This block may only be used within a function with a return value.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_OPERATOR_WHILE_: Run a code while / until a condition is met. Evaluates the condition before executing the first iteration.
Mode: The code will run 'while' or 'until' the condition is met.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_REPEAT_DESCRIPTION: Repeat a set of instructions a number of times.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_REPEAT_STATEMENTS_DO: Do: Set of instructions to repeat.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_REPEAT_FIELDS_REPETITIONS: Repetitions: number of times to repeat.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_REPEAT_TOOLTIP: Repeats a set of instruction a given number of times
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FOR_INPUT_WITH_DESCRIPTION: Repeat a set of instructions a number of times. It uses a variable to iterate from an initial value to an end value, the number of times the instructions are repeated is the difference between the final value minus the initial value plus one.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FOR_INPUT_WITH_STATEMENTS_: Do: Set of instructions to run repetitively
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FOR_INPUT_WITH_INPUTS_WITH: With: variable to use in iterations (iterator).
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FOR_INPUT_WITH_INPUTS_FROM: From: initial value that the iterator takes.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FOR_INPUT_WITH_INPUTS_TO: To: final value reached by the iterator.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FOR_TOOLTIP: Count from a start number to an end number. Each time the count is incremented by one, the variable takes that value then do the statements.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FOR_LOOP_WARNING1: Assuming that the 'from' input is bigger than the 'to' input
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FOR_LOOP_WARNING2: Assuming that the 'from' input is smaller than the 'to' input
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FOR_LOOP_WARNING3: Incorrect use (not sure how to implement this for loop). Use a while loop instead
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_OPERATOR_B: Break/Continue with next iteration of a loop
Instruction to break or continue with the next iteration of a loop
Action: Break or continue with the next iteration of a loop.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_EVERY_TOOLTIP: Execute code every time you want periodically.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_EVERY_DESCRIPTION: Defines a set of 'periodic' tasks to do every elapsed time. This instruction is intended to be used within Arduino's loop, but since it is not using interrupts, the actual execution time will depend on the availability of the processor.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_EVERY_MUTATOR_DESC: Create new periodic tasks by adding them to the container.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_EVERY_STATEMENT_DO: Do: Set of instructions to execute if corresponding task has elapsed the indicated time.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_EVERY_INPUT_TIME: Elapsed Time: Period of the task to execute the code in milliseconds.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ALTERNATE_DESCRIPTION: Defines a set of 'alternative' cases to do. It does only one case each time the instruction is executed (when the last case is executed, the first case will be executed next time). This instruction is intended to be used within Arduino's loop.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ALTERNATE_MUTATOR_DESC: Create new cases by adding them to the container.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ALTERNATE_STATEMENT_DO: Do: Set of instructions to do to be executed for that case.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ALTERNATE_TOOLTIP: Execute code alternatively (one case each time this instruction is executed).
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BASE_DELAY_WAIT_DESCRIPTIO: Wait for the specified time in milliseconds.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BASE_DELAY_WAIT_SEC_DESCRI: Wait for the specified time in seconds.
keys.LANG_CONTROL_YIELD_TOOLTIP: Yields the main flow to attend other tasks
keys.LANG_CONTROL_ESP_DEEP_SLEEP_DESCRIPTION: Sends to a deep sleep state and wake up after a given amount of time to save energy. In order for this instruction to work properly, the RST pin must be connected to D0 for ESP8266 boards (ESP32 does not require such connection).
keys.LANG_CONTROL_ESP_DEEP_SLEEP_TOOLTIP: Sets the board into a deep sleep state for the given seconds with a minimum energy consumption.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BASE_DELAY_TOOLTIP: Waits the specified time in milliseconds (ms)
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BASE_DELAY_SEC_TOOLTIP: Waits the specified time in seconds (s)
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BASE_US_DESCRIPTION: Provides the elapsed time from startup in microseconds.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BASE_US_OUTPUT: Time elapsed from startup in microseconds (long integer).
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BASE_US_TOOLTIP: Number of microseconds since the program started (long integer)
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BASE_MILLIS_DESCRIPTION: Provides the elapsed time from startup in milliseconds.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BASE_MILLIS_OUTPUT: Time elapsed from startup in microseconds (long integer).
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_BASE_MILLIS_TOOLTIP: Number of milliseconds since the program started (long integer)
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_DOWHILE_OPERATOR_DO_DESCRI: Run a code while or until a condition is met. The first iteration is always executed.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_DOWHILE_OPERATOR_DO_DROPDO: Mode: The code will run 'while' or 'until' the condition is met.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_DOWHILE_TOOLTIP: While the condition is true, continue doing the statements.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_EXECUTE_DESCRIPTION: Executes custom Arduino code. Use with care, because it can generate compilation errors if you don't know what you are doing. Code must usually end with a ';'.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_EXECUTE_INPUT_CODE: Code: Arduino cde to include integrated in your Facilino code.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_EXECUTE_TOOLTIP: Executes Arduino code (text). Use with caution, as it can easily break the program and prevent it from compiling.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_SWITCH_DESCRIPTION: Execute a set of instructions depending on the case. Compares the input entry with the different cases. If no case can be found, then a set of default instructions can be executed (default).
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_SWITCH_MUTATOR_DESC: It allows adding other conditions to evaluate 'case' or 'default'.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_SWITCH_INPUTS_CONDITION: Case condition: If true, the stacked instructions associated with the condition are executed.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_SWITCH_TOOLTIP: Implements a conditional execution of the code depending on the value introduce on each case.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_WARNING: Warning: This block may only be used within a loop.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IF_ELSEIF_TOOLTIP: Add a condition to the if block.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IF_ELSE_TOOLTIP: Add a final, catch-all condition to the if block.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IF_IF_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this if block.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_1: If the condition is true, execute the statements.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_NEGATE_DESCRIPTION: Negates the logic of the input. Returns true in case the input is false or false in case the input is true.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_NEGATE_INPUT: Input: Logical value to be evaluated.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_NEGATE_TOOLTIP: Returns the opposite of the input.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_TO_BOOLEAN_DESCRIPTION: This instruction is useful to convert numbers to a boolean variables.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_TO_BOOLEAN_INPUT_NUMBER: Number: Number to convert into a boolean.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_TO_BOOLEAN_OUTPUT: Returns true if a number is bigger than 0 and false otherwise.
keys.LANG_LOGIC_TO_BOOLEAN_TOOLTIP: If a number is bigger than 1, then it returns true. Otherwise, it returns false
keys.LANG_LOGIC_BOOLEAN_TRUE_DESCRIPTION: Constant with a binary value 'true' or 'false'. Used to compare or set binary variables or operations.
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_OP_DESCRIPTION: This instruction allows advanced mathematical operations such as square roots, absolute value (of integers), negative, natural and base10 logarithms, exponentials or base 10 powers).
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_OP_DROPDOWN_OPERATION: Operation: Select the operation to perform (square root, absolute value of integers, negative, natural logarithm, logarithm in base 10, exponential or power of 10).
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_OP_INPUT_NUMBER: Number: Numeric input value on which to perform the operation.
keys.LANG_MATH_SINGLE_OP_OUTPUT: Value resulting from the mathematical operation. Some operations could provide NaN (Not a Number) if the operation is not defined (eg: logarithm or square root of negative numbers).
keys.LANG_MATH_MODULO_DESCRIPTION: The module between two numbers is the reminder of the division.
keys.LANG_MATH_MODULO_TOOLTIP: Returns the remainder of the division of the two input numbers.
keys.LANG_MATH_ADVANCED_MAP_DESCRIPTION: Linearly transforms (mapping) a value between two numbers 'From [min - max]' to another value included between two other numbers 'to [min - max]'. Allows you to set a value to be within the specified linear setting.
keys.LANG_MATH_ADVANCED_MAP_INPUT_FROM_MIN: From (min): minimum value of the input range.
keys.LANG_MATH_ADVANCED_MAP_INPUT_FROM_MAX: From (max): maximum value of the input range.
keys.LANG_MATH_ADVANCED_MAP_INPUT_TO_MIN: to (min): minimum value of the output range.
keys.LANG_MATH_ADVANCED_MAP_INPUT_TO_MAX: to (max): maximum value of the output range.
keys.LANG_MATH_ADVANCED_MAP_TOOLTIP: Re-map the input from a certain range to another.
keys.LANG_MATH_BASE_MAP_DESCRIPTION: Linear scaling (mapping) of a number between the range [0 - 1023] in another range between [0 - 'range']. It allows you to set a value (usually of the analog inputs) in another range, eg from 0 to 255.
keys.LANG_MATH_BASE_MAP_INPUT_MAX: Max: maximum value of the output range.
keys.LANG_MATH_BASE_MAP_TOOLTIP: Re-map the input from [0-1023] to another.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_MINMAX_DESCRIPTION: Retuns the minimum or maximum operation between two numbers.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_RANDOM_DESCRIPTION: Generates a random number (integer) between two values. The function uses a random seed based on the reading of analogue channel A0 (a typical trick to emulated randomness).
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_RANDOM_INPUT_MIN: Min: Initial value of the range.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_RANDOM_INPUT_MAX: Max: End value of the range.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_RANDOM_TOOLTIP: Returns a random number between the two limits.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_CAST_DESCRIPTION: Converts an expression to a number. This instruction allows you to convert the input data to the specified type.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_CAST_DROPDOWN_TYPES: Type: Data type to convert (Integer: It occupies 2 bytes in memory and can represent numbers from -32,768 to 32,767.; Long integer: It occupies 4 bytes in memory and can represent numbers from -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.; Decimal: It occupies 4 bytes in memory and can represent real numbers.; Byte: It occupies 1 byte in memory and can represent numbers from 0 to 255.).
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_SINUSOID_DESCRIPTION: This instruction allows to generate sine waves with definable amplitude, frequency, phase and mean value. The resulting value depends on the evaluated time.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_SINUSOID_INPUT_AMPLIT: Amplitude: amplitude of the signal (difference between peak and peak).
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_SINUSOID_INPUT_FREQUE: Frequency: Number of times the signal is repeated per second (Hz).
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_SINUSOID_INPUT_PHASE: Phase: Horizontal shift of the signal (angle in degrees).
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_SINUSOID_INPUT_MEAN: Mean value: Vertical displacement of the signal.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_SINUSOID_INPUT_TIME: Time: The instant of time in which the signal is evaluated (in microseconds).
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_MATH_SINUSOID_TOOLTIP: Generates a sinusoid wave. Amplitude: Wave amplitude; Frequency: Wave frequency in Hz; Phase: Wave phase in radians; Offset: Offset value added to the wave; Time: Time instant in which the wave is evaluated.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_GET_TOOLTIP: Returns the value of a variable.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_SET_TOOLTIP: Sets the value of a variable.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_GLOBAL_TOOLTIP: Declares and defines a GLOBAL variable of type int or String.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_GLOBAL_CUSTOM_TYPE_NAME: Declare global variable with custom type
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_GLOBAL_TOOLTIP2: Declares and defines a GLOBAL variable of the given type.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_GLOBAL_TOOLTIP3: Declares and defines a user-defined GLOBAL variable using Arduino code.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_LOCAL_TOOLTIP: Declare and define a LOCAL variable of type int or String.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_LOCAL_CUSTOM_TYPE_NAME: Declare local variable with custom type
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_LOCAL_TOOLTIP2: Declares and defines a LOCAL variable of the given type.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_LOCAL_TOOLTIP3: Declares a user-defined LOCAL variable using Arduino code.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_GLOBAL_VOLATILE_TYPE_NAME: Declare global shared variable with type
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_GLOBAL_VOLATILE_TOOLTIP: Declares and defines a GLOBAL shared (volatile, to be used in tasks and interrupts) variable of the given type.
keys.LANG_MATH_ARRAY_GET_DESCRIPTION: This instruction returns the element of an array at the indicated position. The first element of an array variable is position 0.
keys.LANG_MATH_ARRAY_GET_FIELD_INDEX: Index: Position of the element in the array.
keys.LANG_MATH_ARRAY_GET_OUTPUT: Returns a number with the element at the indicated position.
keys.LANG_MATH_ARRAY_SET_DESCRIPTION: This instruction sets the value of an element of an array at the indicated position. The first element of an array variable is position 0.
keys.LANG_MATH_ARRAY_SET_FIELD_INDEX: Index: Position of the element in the array.
keys.LANG_MATH_ARRAY_GET_TOOLTIP: Gets an element from an array.
keys.LANG_MATH_ARRAY_SET_TOOLTIP: Sets an element from an array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_MUTATOR_DESC: It allows to add elements to the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_INPUT_ELEMENT: Element: Element to add to the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY2_DESCRIPTION: Defines an array constant with two numbers.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY2_INPUT1: Element 1: First element of the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY2_INPUT2: Element 2: Second element of the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY3_DESCRIPTION: Defines an array constant with three numbers.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY3_INPUT1: Element 1: First element of the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY3_INPUT2: Element 2: Second element of the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY3_INPUT3: Element 3: Third element of the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY4_DESCRIPTION: Defines an array constant with four numbers.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY4_INPUT1: Element 1: First element of the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY4_INPUT2: Element 2: Second element of the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY4_INPUT3: Element 3: Third element of the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY4_INPUT4: Element 4: Fourth element of the array.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_DECODE_NAME: Decodes (unpacks) an array into several items
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_DECODE_DESCRIPTION: This instruction decodes the elements of an array into several items (copies chunks of memory data of the original array into the items). By clicking on the 'star' icon, you can add items. The size of the variables used in each of the items affects to the decoding process as follows: the array is treated as a byte array (no matter the original type of the array variable) and then, each of the items points to contiguous chunks of data memory. Thus, if the items are 1-byte  sized, the instruction is equivalent to copy them, byte by byte; but if items are 2-byte or 4-byte sized variables, then the instruction copies the values considering the size of the items. This is useful when you decode the array (usually a telegram) into several items.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_DECODE_MUTATOR_DESC: Add items to store the decoded array
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_DECODE_TOOLTIP: Decodes an array into separated values.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_ENCODE_NAME: Encodes (packs) several items into an array
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_ENCODE_DESCRIPTION: This instruction encodes items into an array variable. The size of the array variable must be equal to the sum of all item variable sizes. All items will be encoded in contiguous chuncks of memory data (the array is treated as a byte array, no matter the original type) and the items are copies into the array at their corresponding position (the size of an item will affect to position of the posterior item).
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_ENCODE_MUTATOR_DESC: Add items to encode into an array
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_ENCODE_TOOLTIP: Encodes an array with provided data values. The size of the array must be appropriate for the provided amount of data.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_LOCAL_TYPE_NAME: Declare local array variable with type
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_LOCAL_TOOLTIP: Declare and define a LOCAL array variable of type int.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_GLOBAL_TYPE_NAME: Declare global array variable with type
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_GLOBAL_VOLATILE_NAM: Declare global shared array variable with type
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_GLOBAL_TOOLTIP: Declares and defines a GLOBAL array variable of type int.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_GLOBAL_TOOLTIP2: Declares and defines a GLOBAL array variable of the given type.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_ARRAY_GLOBAL_VOLATILE_TOO: Declares and defines a GLOBAL shared (volatile, to be used in tasks and interrupts) array variable of the given type.
keys.LANG_TEXT_TEXT_TOOLTIP: A letter, word, or line of text.
keys.LANG_TEXT_JOIN_TOOLTIP: Create a piece of text by joining together any number of items.
keys.LANG_TEXT_APPEND_TO_NAME: Appends text to a String variable
keys.LANG_TEXT_APPEND_TOOLTIP: Append some text to string variable %1.
keys.LANG_TEXT_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: Returns number of letters (including spaces) in the provided text.
keys.LANG_TEXT_LENGTH_LOWER_TOOLTIP: Sets a string to lower case.
keys.LANG_TEXT_LENGTH_UPPER_NAME: Sets a string to upper case
keys.LANG_TEXT_LENGTH_UPPER_TOOLTIP: Sets a string in upper case.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_SERIAL_WRITE_TOOLTIP: Writes an array of characters on the serial port
keys.LANG_TEXT_CHARAT_TOOLTIP: Returns the char at the specified position (starting from 0)
keys.LANG_TEXT_EQUALSIGNORECASE_TOOLTIP: Checks if both input strings are equal, regardless of the case.
keys.LANG_TEXT_SUBSTRING_TOOLTIP: Obtain a substring from the input string with the characters between the two input numbers.
keys.LANG_TEXT_SEARCH_TOOLTIP: Checks if a text is found in another text string. Returns the index of the first/last instance found.
keys.LANG_TEXT_CONTAINS_TOOLTIP: Checks if a text string contains an expression. Returns true or false.
keys.LANG_TEXT_CSV_TOOLTIP: Converts an array into a CSV (comma separated value) string
keys.LANG_TEXT_CAST_TOOLTIP: Cast the number/variable into a text
keys.LANG_TEXT_NUMBER_CAST_TOOLTIP: Converts the string into a number
keys.LANG_TEXT_CREATE_JOIN_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the text.
keys.LANG_TEXT_CREATE_JOIN_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this text block.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_SERIAL_AVAILABLE_WARNING: You need to connect a device or PC connected to your remote device.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_SERIAL_AVAILABLE_TOOLTIP: Check whether the serial port is available or not
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_SERIAL_PARSEINT_TOOLTIP: First valid (long) integer number from the serial buffer
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_SERIAL_PARSEFLOAT_TOOLTIP: First valid decimal number from the serial buffer
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_SERIAL_PRINTLN_TOOLTIP: Prints data as ASCII text and adds a Carriage Return (CR).
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_SERIAL_PLOT_TOOLTIP: Sends serial data to be plot in Arduino's Serial Plotter.
keys.LANG_PLOT_CREATE_JOIN_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the plot.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_SERIAL_READ_TOOLTIP: Reads incoming serial data from serial port as bytes.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_SERIAL_READSTRING_TOOLTIP: Reads incoming serial data from serial port as ASCII text.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_CONVERSION_TOOLTIP: Convert a number from one base to another.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_SERIAL_TIMEOUT_TOOLTIP: Sets timeout for serial reception (in milliseconds).
keys.LANG_LCD_DEF1_TOOLTIP: Block that defines the LCD connected to I2C
keys.LANG_LCD_PRINT_TOOLTIP: Prints a String in the LCD at the specified position or the next available one.
keys.LANG_LCD_CURSOR_TOOLTIP: Sets the cursor to print a text
keys.LANG_LCD_SCROLL_TOOLTIP: Scrolls a String in the LCD at the specified row
keys.LANG_LCD_SETBACKLIGHT_TOOLTIP: Sets the backlight of the LCD screen.
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_INOUT_ANALOG_READ_TOOLTIP: Reads the value from a specified analog pin
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_INOUT_ANALOG_WRITE_TOOLTIP: Write a value between 0 and 255 to a specific analog output PIN
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_BUILTIN_LED_NAME: Turns on/off or toggles the on-board LED
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_BUILTIN_LED_TOOLTIP: Built-in LED that is internally connected to PIN 13
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_INOUT_DIGITAL_READ_TOOLTIP: Reads the value from a specified digital pin
keys.LANG_ADVANCED_INOUT_DIGITAL_WRITE_TOOLTI: Write a value in a specified digital pin
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_PIN_PWM_TOOLTIP: A digital PWM PIN (a.k.a analog output)
keys.LANG_BQ_BUTTON_NAME: Read the status of a button
keys.LANG_BQ_BUTTON_CASE_NAME: Discriminates the status of a button
keys.LANG_BQ_BUTTON_LONG_SHORT_NAME: Short or long click with a button
keys.LANG_TWO_BUTTONS_UI_TOOLTIP: Implements a simple User Interface (UI) with two buttons with menus and options.
keys.LANG_TWO_BUTTONS_UI_OPTION_TOOLTIP: an option in the two-button user interface.
keys.LANG_BQ_BUTTON_LONG_SHORT_TOOLTIP: Discriminates how long the button is pressed
keys.LANG_ZUM_BUTTON_TOOLTIP: Reads an input in pull-up mode.
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_COMMAND_PREDEF_TOOLTIP: Receive a predefined command through Bluetooth module
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_COMMAND_NUM_TOOLTIP: Receive a given command through Bluetooth module (byte 0~255)
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_TELEGRAM_RECV_TOOLTIP: Decode telegrams received through the Bluetooth module
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_TELEGRAM_PREDEF_TOOLTIP: Sends a predefined telegram of the specified type
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_TELEGRAM_NUM_TOOLTIP: Sends a telegram of the specified type (command)
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_TELEGRAM_DECODE_TOOLTIP: Decode a telegram (extracts data based on the telegram type)
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_TELEGRAM_DECODE_NUM_TOOLT: Returns data at the given position
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_TELEGRAM_SEND_TOOLTIP: Code telegrams and send them through the Bluetooth module
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_RECEIVE_TOOLTIP: Returns the data received by the Bluetooth module
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_SEND_TOOLTIP: Sends the input data using the Bluetooth module
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_SERIAL_AVAILABLE_TOOLTIP: Execute commands if bluetooth serial has data
keys.LANG_WIFI_ESP8266_DEF_TOOLTIP: Wifi module configuration (integrated or not integrated)
keys.LANG_WIFI_ESP8266_ISCONNECTED_TOOLTIP: Returns true if it is connected
keys.LANG_WIFI_ESP8266_TCP_OPEN_TOOLTIP: Open a TCP/IP connection through the specified port
keys.LANG_WIFI_ESP8266_RECV_TOOLTIP: Receives data from the TCP/IP connection
keys.LANG_WIFI_ESP8266_SEND_TOOLTIP: Sends data through the TCP/IP connection
keys.LANG_WIFI_ESP8266_HTTP_SERVER_TOOLTIP: Creates a web server base on HTTP protocol with ESP8266 module (not integrated)
keys.LANG_WIFI_OTA_SET_DEVICENAME_TOOLTIP: Sets the hostname for your device (you can upload code using its hostname instead of the IP address).
keys.LANG_WIFI_OTA_SET_PASSWORD_TOOLTIP: Sets a password for your device (to prevent someone else to upload code into your device).
keys.LANG_LED_MATRIX_PREDEF_TOOLTIP: Build an predefined expression for LED Matrix
keys.LANG_LED_MATRIX_GENERIC_TOOLTIP: Build a generic expression for LED Matrix
keys.LANG_LED_MATRIX_DRAWING_TOOLTIP: Joins cols/rows for building an expression for LED Matrix.
keys.LANG_LED_MATRIX_DRAWING_STREAM_TOOLTIP: Shows a stream of text on the LED Matrix
keys.LANG_LED_MATRIX_STREAM_TOOLTIP: Text to show as a stream on the LED Matrix
keys.LANG_LED_MATRIX_DRAWING_SEQUENTIALLY_TOO: Shows a stream of expressions on the LED Matrix
keys.LANG_LED_MATRIX_ROW_TOOLTIP: Build an row for LED Matrix.
keys.LANG_LED_MATRIX_DRAWING_ICONS_NAME: Image to show on 8x8 LED matrix
keys.LANG_LED_MATRIX_DRAWING_ICONS_TOOLTIP: Image to show on the LEDs matrix
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_TASKS_DESCRIPTION: Defines a set of periodic tasks using the Arduino timer0. All instructions that use timer0 or delays may be affected. It has a stack for instructions that are always executed (every millisecond) and another stacks for tasks that are executed periodically.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_TASKS_MUTATOR_DESC: Create new periodic tasks by adding them to the container
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_TASKS_STATEMENT_ALWAYS: Always do: Set of instructions to execute every millisecond.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_TASKS_STATEMENT_TASK: Task: Set of instructions to execute to the specified period.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_STATE_MACHINE_DESCRIPTION: It allows to define a state machine. You can add initial states (initialized from the beginning) or standard states (not initialized). Both will be activated and deactivated according to their activation and deactivation conditions when running the state machine
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_STATE_MACHINE_MUTATOR_DESC: Adds new states to the state machine. The initial states are active at startup.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_STATE_MACHINE_STATEMENT_ST: State: Set up instructions to execute in case the corresponding state is active.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_TRANSITION_COND_FROM_TO_DE: Defines a transition between states. An AND convergence can be created if it is combined with the concatenation instruction or OR divergences / convergences if several of these instructions are stacked.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_TRANSITION_COND_FROM_TO_IN: Condition: Transition condition. If true, the state(s) defined in 'from' will be deactivated.
States: State(s) to deactivate in case of transition condition becomes true.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_TRANSITION_COND_TO_FROM_DE: Defines a transition between states. An AND divergence can be created if it is combined with the concatenation instruction or OR divergences / convergences can be created if several of these instructions are stacked.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_TRANSITION_COND_TO_FROM_IN: Condition: Transition condition. If true, the state(s) defined in 'to' will be activated.
State: State(s) to be activated in case of transition condition becomes true.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_STATE_DESCRIPTION: Defines a state to be used in a state machine.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_STATE_CONC_DESCRIPTION: Generates an AND condition between two states for AND between states and AND divergence transitions.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_STATE_CONC_INPUT_EXPRESSIO: Logical expression of states: Logical expression of states to concatenate (AND).
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_STATE_MACHINE_TRANSITION_T: Transition from a state to another state (direct) or AND divergence to several states (contatenating them)
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_STATE_MACHINE_TRANSITION_F: Transition to a state from another state (direct) or AND convergence (sinchronization) from several states (contatenating them)
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ATTACH_INTERRUPT_DESCRIPTI: Manages interrupts of Arduino and ESP processors. Interrupts can be programmed in "low state", "change", "rising edge" or "falling edge" mode. The code included within the interrupt is executed with higher priority than main loop code.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ATTACH_INTERRUPT_DROPDOWN_: Pin: Interrupt pin to be used.
Mode: Interrupt mode, "low state", "change", "rising edge" or "falling edge".
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ATTACH_INTERRUPT_STATEMENT: Do: Set of instructions to be executed within the interrupt in case is triggered.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_WAIT_DESCRIPTION: Wait until a condition between two values ?has been met.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_WAIT_TOOLTIP: Wait until the condition is true between two inputs.
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_COMMAND_TOOLTIP: Receive a command through Bluetooth module
keys.LANG_BLUETOOTH_TELEGRAM_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Decode a telegram received through Bluetooth module
keys.LANG_US_TOOLTIP: Returns the distance measured by the ultrasonic sensor.
keys.LANG_LIDAR_TOOLTIP: Returns the distance measured by the lidar sensor.
keys.LANG_US_COLLISION_TOOLTIP: Detects collision or free cases based on a distance threshold with the ultrasonic sensor
keys.LANG_US_KEEPDISTANCE_TOOLTIP: Returns the speed to be applied to the robot in order to keep a distance using the ultrasonic sensor
keys.LANG_US_SPEED_TOOLTIP: Returns the speed to be applied to the robot in order to keep a speed to follow an object at a given distance using the ultrasonic sensor
keys.LANG_INFRARED_ANALOG_TOOLTIP: Returns the analog value measured by the infrared sensor.
keys.LANG_INFRARED_DIGITAL_TOOLTIP: Returns the digital value measured by the infrared sensor.
keys.LANG_LINE_FOLLOWING_TOOLTIP: Returns the turn value to apply to the base to follow a line.
keys.LANG_LINE_FOLLOWING_BINARY_TOOLTIP: Discriminates between three cases to follow a line: black, grey (just in the middle) or white.
keys.LANG_LINE_FOLLOWING_WHITE_TOOLTIP: Returns the calibrated value of the white colour of a line.
keys.LANG_LINE_FOLLOWING_BLACK_TOOLTIP: Returns the calibrated value of the black colour of a line.
keys.LANG_LINE_FOLLOWING_CALIBRATE_WHITE_TOOL: Calibrates the white colour value of a line.
keys.LANG_LINE_FOLLOWING_CALIBRATE_BLACK_TOOL: Calibrates the black colour value of a line.
keys.LANG_RGB_LED_TOOLTIP: Set a colour on a RGB LED
keys.LANG_RGB_SENSOR_NAME: Detects RGB color with sensor TCS3200
keys.LANG_PIEZO_MP3_TOOLTIP: Defines a DFPlayer device to reproduce MP3/WAV sound files.
keys.LANG_PIEZO_MP3_PLAYER_PLAY_TOOLTIP: Reproduces a sound file with the given number.
keys.LANG_PIEZO_MP3_PLAYER_PLAY_FOLDER_TOOLTI: Reproduces a sound file with the given folder number and file number
keys.LANG_PIEZO_MP3_PLAYER_ISPLAYING_TOOLTIP: Returns true if a file is being reproduced
keys.LANG_PIEZO_MP3_PLAYER_VOLUME_TOOLTIP: Sets the volume for the sound files to be reproduced
keys.LANG_PIEZO_MP3_PLAYER_LOOP_FOLDER_TOOLTI: Loops songs over a given folder number
keys.LANG_PIEZO_BUZZER_VOICE_TOOLTIP: Generates a voice with the piezo buzzer (only works on PIN 3)
keys.LANG_PIEZO_BUZZER_VOICE_DESCRIPTION: Emits a voice sound with a buzzer. This instruction only works by connecting the buzzer to the Arduino pin 3 to generate a PWM signal. The quality of the buzzer can clearly affect the voice, which can be heard clearly digitized and of low quality.
keys.LANG_PIEZO_BUZZER_VOICE_INPUT_VOICE: Voice: Pointer to a variable that contains a word.
keys.LANG_PIEZO_BUZZER_PREDEF_VOICE_DESCRIPTI: Returns a variable with a digitized word to be used in the buzzer voice command.
keys.LANG_PIEZO_BUZZER_PREDEF_VOICE_OUTPUT: Variable with a pointer to the word to be pronounced.
keys.LANG_PIEZO_BUZZER_PREDEF_VOICE_TOOLTIP: Generates a wave with a word
keys.LANG_MIC_TOOLTIP: Reads the analog value of the mic
keys.LANG_MIC_DIGITAL_TOOLTIP: Reads the digital value of the mic (true if the volume is too high)
keys.LANG_PIEZO_BUZZER_MELODY_TOOLTIP: Generates a melody (string with frequencies and durations)
keys.LANG_MUSIC_NOTE_TOOLTIP: Generates a musical note (frequency and duration)
keys.LANG_SERVO_CONT_TOOLTIP: Generates movements with a continuous rotation servo.
keys.LANG_SERVO_DC_MOTOR_TOOLTIP: Generates movements with a DC motor
keys.LANG_SERVO_GRIPPER_MOVE_TOOLTIP: Sets gripper fingers angles for given positions
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_NAME: Move robot base with servo motors
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_TOOLTIP: Send commands to movement servos (left and right) from linear and angular velocities.
keys.LANG_MOVE_FBLR_TOOLTIP: Send simple commands to left and right servos
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_CC_NAME: Move robot base with DC motors
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_CC_TOOLTIP: Send commands to movement DC motors (left and right) from linear and angular velocities.
keys.LANG_MOVE_FBLR_CC_NAME: Simple movement robot base with DC motors
keys.LANG_MOVE_FBLR_CC_TOOLTIP: Send simple commands to left and right DC motors
keys.LANG_MOVE_GRIP_TOOLTIP: Send commands to set fingers open or close
keys.LANG_SERVO_MOVE_ARMS_NAME: Sets arm angles for given positions
keys.LANG_SERVO_MOVE_ARMS_TOOLTIP: Sets arm angles for given positions
keys.LANG_MOVE_ARMS_TOOLTIP: Send commands to set hands up or down
keys.LANG_TEMP_LM35_DESCRIPTION: Returns the temperature in Celsius degrees of the temperature sensor LM35 or NTC.
keys.LANG_TEMP_LM35_INPUT_PIN: Pin: Analog pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_TEMP_LM35_OUTPUT: Temperature returned by the sensor (in Celsius degrees).
keys.LANG_TEMP_LM35_TOOLTIP: Returns the temperature in Celsius degrees using a LM35 or NTC analog temperature sensor
keys.LANG_TEMP_REQUEST_AND_READ_TEMP_DESCRIPT: Returns the temperature in Celsius or Farenheit degrees with the temperature sensor DS18B20.
keys.LANG_TEMP_DALLAS_REQUIREMENTS: This instruction requires Dallas Temperature installed on Arduino IDE.
keys.LANG_TEMP_REQUEST_AND_READ_TEMP_INPUT_PI: Bus Pin: Pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_TEMP_REQUEST_AND_READ_TEMP_TOOLTIP: Requests and reads the 18B20 temperature sensor in Celsius or Fahrenheit degrees
keys.LANG_TEMP_RESOLUTION_DESCRIPTION: Sets the resolution of the DS18B20 temperature sensor, with higher resolutions, the reading is more accurate.
keys.LANG_TEMP_RESOLUTION_INPUT_PIN: Bus Pin: Pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM_DESCRIPTION: Checks the temperature alarm levels of the DHT11/DHT21/DHT22 sensor and, if an alarm is triggered, executes the corresponding code. Alarm levels are automatically set so that they are considered within the comfort temperatures of a room and uses both temperature and humidity to determine the appropriate situation based on .
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM_DHT_DROPDOWN_MODEL: Sensor: Model of the sensor used DHT11/DHT21/DHT22.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM_DHT_INPUT_PIN: Bus Pin: Pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM_DHT_STATEMENT_HIGH: High temperature: Set of instructions to be executed in case of reading a temperature higher than the established high-temperature alarm level.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM_DHT_STATEMENT_MEDIUM: Medium temperature: Set of instructions to be executed in case of reading a temperature below the set high-temperature alarm level and below the low-temperature alarm level.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM_DHT_STATEMENT_LOW: Low temperature: Set of instructions to be executed in case of reading a temperature below the set low-temperature alarm level.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM_DHT_FIELD_WARN: Warn just once: Activate this checkbox to execute the code inside each of the cases just once. The code will not be executed again unless it changes from one state to another.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM2_DESCRIPTION: Checks the temperature alarm levels of the DS18B20 sensor and, if an alarm is triggered, execute the corresponding code.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM2_INPUT_PIN: Bus Pin: Pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM2_STATEMENT_HIGH: High temperature: Set of instructions to be executed in case of reading a temperature higher than the established high-temperature alarm level.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM2_STATEMENT_LOW: Low temperature: Set of instructions to be executed in case of reading a temperature below the set low-temperature alarm level.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM_SET_DESCRIPTION: Sets high or low temperature alarm level.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM2_DROPDOWN_TYPE: Alarm type: Type of alarm to be set to high or low.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM_SET_INPUT_PIN: Bus Pin: Pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_TEMP_ALARM_SET_INPUT_TEMPERATURE: Temperature: Alarm temperature value in Celsius degrees.
keys.LANG_MOIST_READ_MOIST_TOOLTIP: Reads values from a moisture sensor
keys.LANG_HUMID_READ_HUMID_DHT_TOOLTIP: Reads DHT11, DHT21, DHT22 humidity sensor in %
keys.LANG_TEMP_READ_TEMP_DHT_DESCRIPTION: Returns the temperature in Celsius degrees of the humidity sensor DHT11 / DHT21 / DHT22.
keys.LANG_TEMP_DHT_REQUIREMENTS: This instruction requires DHT Adafruit Library and Adafruit Unified Sensor Library installed on Arduino IDE.
keys.LANG_TEMP_READ_TEMP_DHT_TOOLTIP: Reads the DHT11, DHT21 DHT22 temperature sensor in Celsius degrees
keys.LANG_TEMP_READ_TEMP_HTU_TOOLTIP: Reads the HTU21D temperature sensor in Celsius degrees
keys.LANG_TEMP_READ_TEMP_DHT_DROPDOWN_MODEL: Sensor: Model of the sensor used DHT11/DHT21/DHT22.
keys.LANG_TEMP_READ_TEMP_DHT_INPUT_PIN: Pin: Pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_THERMAL_COMFORT_TOOLTIP: Determines the thermal comfort based on temperature and humidity readings
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_ANALOG_DESCRIPTION: Returns the value of the rain sensor's analog signal.
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_ANALOG_INPUT_PIN: Pin: Analog pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_ANALOG_TOOLTIP: Reads the quantity of water or rain (from 0 to 1023)
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_DIGITAL_DESCRIPTION: Returns the value of the rain sensor digital signal. The sensitivity of the potentiometer must be adjusted to determine if it is raining or not.
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_DIGITAL_INPUT_PIN: Pin: Digital pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_DIGITAL_OUTPUT: True or false depending on whether it rains or not.
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_LEVEL_DESCRIPTION: Discriminates the amount of rain from the rain sensor and executes the corresponding code.
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_LEVEL_INPUT_PIN: Pin: Analog pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_LEVEL_STATEMENT_INTENSE_RA: Intense rain: Set of instructions to run in case of rain (intense).
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_LEVEL_STATEMENT_SOFT_RAIN: Soft rain: Set of instructions to run in case of rain (soft).
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_LEVEL_STATEMENT_NO_RAIN: Dry: Set of instructions to run in case there is no rain.
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_SET_LEVEL_DESCRIPTION: Sets a intensity rain level (heavy rain or soft rain). The values ??correspond to the minimum values ??for intense rain or solf rain.
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_SET_LEVEL_DROPDOWN_TYPE: Level Type: Type of level to set (intense or soft rain).
keys.LANG_RAINDROP_SET_LEVEL_INPUT_PIN: Pin: Analog pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_PRESSURE_READ_PRESSURE_BMP_DESCRIPT: Returns the atmospheric pressure of the barometric sensor BMP180 in Pascals (the sensor is connected to the I2C bus)
keys.LANG_PRESSURE_BMP_REQUIREMENTS: This instruction requires BMP085 Adafruit Library installed on Arduino IDE.
keys.LANG_PRESSURE_READ_ALTITUDE_BMP_DESCRIPT: Returns an estimate of the altitude with the barometric sensor BMP180 (the sensor is connected to the I2C bus). Requires that we provide atmospheric pressure at sea level (otherwise a value of 101325 pascals is provided).
keys.LANG_PRESSURE_BMP_INPUT_PREASURE: Pressure: Atmospheric pressure at sea-level in Pascals.
keys.LANG_PRESSURE_READ_PRESSURE_BMP_TOOLTIP: Reads barometric pressure from BMP180 sensor in Pa
keys.LANG_TEMP_READ_TEMP_BMP_TOOLTIP: Reads the temperature from BMP180 barometric sensor in Celsius degrees
keys.LANG_ALTITUDE_READ_ALTITUDE_BMP_TOOLTIP: Estimates altitude. If the sea-level pressure is provided the estimation is more accurate. Otherwise, a pressure of 101325 Pa at sealevel it is assumed.
keys.LANG_GUVA_S12SD_DESCRIPTION: Returns the radiation measured value in mWatts/cm^2 or the UV-index with GUVA S12SD sensor.
keys.LANG_GUVA_S12SD_DROPDOWN_RADIATION: Radiation: Units in mWatts/cm^2 or in UV-index.
keys.LANG_GUVA_S12SD_INPUT_PIN: Pin: Analog pin to which the sensor is connected to.
keys.LANG_GUVA_S12SD_OUTPUT: Radiation level in mWatts/cm^2 or in UV-index.
keys.LANG_GUVA_S12SD_TOOLTIP: Reads radiation level from UV sensor GUVA-S12SD
keys.LANG_WIFI_ESP8266_HTML_ATTRIBUTE_TOOLTIP: Creates an attribute for a HTML tag
keys.LANG_WIFI_ESP8266_HTML_TEXT_TOOLTIP: Creates a text to include it in an HTML tag
keys.LANG_WIFI_ESP8266_HTML_TEXT_FORMAT_TOOLT: Creates a formatted text to include it in an HTML tag
keys.LANG_SPI_TRANSFER_NAME: Send data over a SPI communication
keys.LANG_SPI_TRANSFER_RECV_NAME: Send and receive data over a SPI communication
keys.LANG_SPI_END_TOOLTIP: Ends a SPI communication allowing other libraries to use the SPI bus.
keys.LANG_SPI_TRANSFER_TOOLTIP: Sends data through the SPI bus. Received data are not returned.
keys.LANG_SPI_TRANSFER_RECV_TOOLTIP: Sends data through the SPI bus. Received data are returned.
keys.LANG_SPI_INTERRUPT_TOOLTIP: Specifies that this SPI communication is going to be used in an interrupt.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ATTACH_INTERRUPT_COUNTER_D: Counts the number of times a signal has triggered an interrupt. If the interrupt has been triggered since last time, then executes the code inside the instruction. Interrupts can be set in "low state", "change", "rising edge" or "falling edge" mode. This instruction is expected to be included in main loop code, while the code implemented for the interrupt is simply increasing a counter.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ATTACH_INTERRUPT_COUNTER_S: Do: Set of instructions to be executed within the interrupt in case is triggered.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ATTACH_INTERRUPT_COUNTER_T: Implements a counter of a digital signal in an interrupt.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_ATTACH_INTERRUPT_COUNTER2_: Returns the number of times a signal has triggered an interrupt. Interrupts can be set in "low state", "change", "rising edge" or "falling edge" mode. This instruction is expected to be included in main loop code, while the code implemented for the interrupt is simply increasing a counter.
Pin: Interrupt pin to be used.
Mode: Interrupt mode, "low state", "change", "rising edge" or "falling edge".
Number of times the interrupt has been triggered.
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_DEVICEHUB_OPEN_TOOLTIP: Opens a DeviceHub session for publishing data with an IOT device
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_DEVICEHUB_GET_TOOLTIP: Gets data from a DeviceHub actuator
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_SEND_MAIL_TOOLTIP: Sends an email using a GMail account
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_GSHEETS_UPDATE_TOOLTIP: Updates a Google Sheets range with the given value.
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_GSHEETS_APPEND_TOOLTIP: Appends a row to a Google Sheets for the given values.
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_GSHEETS_SETUP_TOOPTIP: Setups a Google Sheets connection using Google Scripts.
keys.LANG_ESPUI_ESPUI_TOOLTIP: Creates a web interface on the ESP32/ESP8266
keys.LANG_ESPUI_BUTTON_BUTTON_NAME: Creates a button (web-based user-interface for ESP processors)
keys.LANG_ESPUI_PRINT_LABEL_NAME: Modifies label text (web-based user-interface for ESP processors)
keys.LANG_ESPUI_LABEL_LABEL_NAME: Creates a label (web-based user-interface for ESP processors)
keys.LANG_ESPUI_LABEL_TOOLTIP: A web interface label you can update from your code
keys.LANG_ESPUI_SWITCH_SWITCH_NAME: Creates a switch (web-based user-interface for ESP processors)
keys.LANG_ESPUI_PAD_PAD_NAME: Creates a button pad (web-based user-interface for ESP processors)
keys.LANG_ESPUI_SLIDER_SLIDER_NAME: Creates a slider (web-based user-interface for ESP processors)
keys.LANG_ESPUI_SLIDER_LABEL_NAME: Returns the value of a slider (web interface for ESP processors)
keys.LANG_ESPUI_SLIDER_VALUE_TOOLTIP: Returns the current value of the slider (between 0 and 100).
keys.LANG_SIMPLEEXPRESSIONS_LED_STRIP_TOOLTIP: Sets data for a LEDs strip pixel for individual or all pixels
keys.LANG_SIMPLEEXPRESSIONS_LED_STRIP_HUE_TOO: Sets color hue on a LEDs strip for individual or all pixels. It can be used to generate random colors between 0 and 65535.
keys.LANG_SIMPLEEXPRESSIONS_LED_STRIP_GRADIEN: Set LEDs strip gradient of colors
Sets a gradient of colors based on an initial and final hue. It automatically detects if the gradient must be ascent or descent depending on the values used.
keys.LANG_SIMPLEEXPRESSIONS_LED_STRIP2_TOOLTI: Sets data for all pixels in a LED strip
keys.LANG_SIMPLEEXPRESSIONS_LED_STRIP_ALL_PIX: Used to indicate to set all pixels in a LEDs strip
keys.LANG_SIMPLEEXPRESSIONS_LED_STRIP_PREDEFI: Predefined expression for a 7-RGB LEDs strip
Provides pre-defined expressions for a 7-RGB LEDs strip
keys.LANG_SIMPLEEXPRESSIONS_LED_STRIP_CUSTOMI: Customized expression for a 7-RGB LEDs strip
Provides customized expressions for a 7-RGB LEDs strip
keys.LANG_LED_STRIP_SEQUENTIALLY_TOOLTIP: A set of customized expressions for a 7-RGB LEDs strip
keys.LANG_LED_STRIP_SEQUENTIALLY_MUTATOR_TOOL: Container ofr customized expressions for a 7-RGB LEDs strip
keys.LANG_LED_STRIP_SEQUENTIALLY_ITEM_TOOLTIP: A customized expression for a 7-RGB LEDs strip
keys.LANG_SIMPLEEXPRESSIONS_SHOWMOUTH_TOOLTIP: Draw an expression on the WS2812 led strip (ring-7)
keys.LANG_SIMPLEEXPRESSIONS_LED_STRIP_STREAM_: Draws a set of expressions on the WS2812 led strip (ring-7)
keys.LANG_PIEZO_BUZZER_PREDEF_SOUNDS_TOOLTIP: Plays some basic sounds based on SimpleExpressions library
keys.LANG_LARS_INIT_TOOLTIP: Defines the servo pins for a quadruped robot.
keys.LANG_LARS_MOVEMENT_TOOLTIP: Generates movement primitives for a quadruped robot
keys.LANG_HIPPIE_INIT_TOOLTIP: Defines the servo pins for a biped robot.
keys.LANG_HIPPIE_MOVEMENT_TOOLTIP: Generates movement primitives for a biped robot
keys.LANG_HIPPIE_ADV_MOVEMENT_TOOLTIP: Generates advanced movement for a biped robot
keys.LANG_ESPUI_LABEL_PRINT_TOOLTIP: Sets the text of a web interface label
keys.LANG_STEPPER_SET_SPEED_TOOLTIP: Sets the speed of a Stepper motor at which it will turn when generating steps
keys.LANG_STEPPER_STEPS_TOOLTIP: Moves the motor the given number of steps
keys.LANG_MOVE_FBLR_STEPPER_NAME: Move robot base with stepper motors
keys.LANG_MOVE_FBLR_STEPPER_TOOLTIP: Moves a robot base actuated with stepper motors
keys.LANG_RGB_CLASSIFY_TOOLTIP: Execute block instructions for corresponding colour
keys.LANG_GAS_ANALOG_READ_TOOLTIP: Reads the analog output of a gas sensor
keys.LANG_GAS_DIGITAL_READ_TOOLTIP: Reads the digital output of a gas sensor
keys.LANG_GAS_CALIBRATE_TOOLTIP: Calibrates the gas sensor by computing the R0 value
keys.LANG_GAS_READ_CALIBRATED_TOOLTIP: Reads the calibrated gas sensor measurement (in ppm)
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_PATH_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: Gets the path length in cm.
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_SET_POSITION_TOOLTIP: This instruction sets the position of the robot to the given values.
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_SET_ENCODERS_TOOLTIP: This instruction sets the encoder system connected to the interrupts.The robot position will be updated automatically based on encoders interrupts.
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_POSITION_X_TOOLTIP: This instruction returns the X position of the robot in cm.
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_POSITION_Y_TOOLTIP: This instruction returns the Y position of the robot in cm.
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_POSITION_ORIENTATION_TOOL: This instruction returns the orientation of the robot in degrees.
keys.LANG_MOVE_BASE_VELOCITY_TOOLTIP: Gets the wheel's velocity in RPM.
keys.LANG_SYSTEM_CONTROL_PID_CONTROLLER_TOOLT: This instruction implements a PID controller. First computes the error between the reference and the signal, then it computes and output proportional to the error, its integral and its derivative.
keys.LANG_SYSTEM_CONTROL_ONOFF_CONTROLLER_TOO: This instruction implements an On/Off controller. This controller include a hysteresis so that the On and Off cases are only executed if the value of the input is above or below the indicated thresholds, respectively.
keys.LANG_SYSTEM_CONTROL_FILTER_LOWPASS_TOOLT: Implements a low-pass filter (exponential moving average). The weight represents the fraction of the input signal to be considered.
keys.LANG_SYSTEM_CONTROL_FILTER_HIGHPASS_TOOL: Implements a high-pass filter (exponential moving average). The weight represents the fraction of the input signal to be rejected.
keys.LANG_SYSTEM_CONTROL_FILTER_BANDPASS_TOOL: Implements a band-pass filter (exponential moving average). The weights represents the fractions of the range of the input signal to pass.
keys.LANG_SYSTEM_CONTROL_FILTER_BANDSTOP_TOOL: Implements a band-stop filter (exponential moving average). The weights represents the fractions of the range of the input signal to be reject.
keys.LANG_SERVO_MOVE_ATTACK_DEFEND_TOOLTIP: This instruction generates servo movement for an arms swipe. It moves the servo from the 'from' position to the 'to' position and then moves backwards to the 'from' position in a given amount of time.
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_TEXT_TOOLTIP: Writes a text at the given position and size
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_IMAGE_TOOLTIP: Sets an image at the given position
keys.LANG_OLED_LINE_TOOLTIP: Draws a line with the given coordinates
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_HEADER_TEXT_NAME: OLED write text on header region
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_HEADER_TEXT_TOOLTIP: Sets the header text (maximum number of characters is 18) for a OLED 128x32 display SSD1306.
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_MAIN_TEXT_NAME: OLED write text on main region
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_MAIN_TEXT_TOOLTIP: Sets the central text (maximum number of characters is 8) for a OLED 128x32 display SSD1306.
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_MAIN_IMAGE_TOOLTIP: Sets the central image (size is 96x16) for a OLED 128x32 display SSD1306.
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_FOOTER_TEXT_NAME: OLED write text on footer region
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_FOOTER_TEXT_TOOLTIP: Sets the footer text (maximum number of characters is 18) for a OLED 128x32 display SSD1306.
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_CHAR_TOOLTIP: Sets a char on one of the corners or sides
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_SMALL_ICON_TOOLTIP: Sets one of the four corners icons (size is 8x8) for a OLED 128x32 display SSD1306.
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_LARGE_ICON_TOOLTIP: Sets one of the two side images (size is 16x16) for a OLED 128x32 display SSD1306.
keys.LANG_OLED_SET_MAIN_IMAGE_NAME: OLED show image on main region
keys.LANG_OLED_SMALL_ICON_TOOLTIP: Provides a small icon of 8x8 size
keys.LANG_OLED_LARGE_ICON_TOOLTIP: Provides a large icon of 16x16 size
keys.LANG_I2C_READ_BYTE_TOOLTIP: This instruction reads a byte from a I2C device at the given address.
keys.LANG_I2C_READ_BYTES_TOOLTIP: This instruction reads bytes from a I2C device at the given address. Data is stored in a 1D array variable.
keys.LANG_I2C_SEND_BYTES_TOOLTIP: This instruction sends bytes to a I2C device. It can send constant data, numeric data (stored in variables) or 1D arrays. Depending on the data, the number of bytes sent may change.
keys.LANG_I2C_ON_REQUEST_BYTES_TOOLTIP: This instruction sends bytes to a I2C master device when requested. It is intented to be used by a slave device to send constant data, numeric data (stored in variables) or 1D arrays. Depending on the data, the number of bytes sent may change.
keys.LANG_I2C_ON_RECEIVE_BYTES_TOOLTIP: This instruction receives bytes from a I2C master devices. Data must be read using the reading instruction, but the amount of bytes received are indicated in a variable 'numBytes'.
keys.LANG_EEPROM_CLEAR_TOOLTIP: Erases all contents of the EEMPROM memory. Use with caution to extend EEPROM life cycle.
keys.LANG_EEPROM_SIZE_TOOLTIP: Defines the size of the EEPROM to use.
keys.LANG_EEPROM_READ_BYTE_TOOLTIP: Reads a byte at given address of the EEPROM memory.
keys.LANG_EEPROM_READ_BYTES_TOOLTIP: Reads bytes at the given address of the EEPROM memory. Data is stored in a 1D array variable.
keys.LANG_EEPROM_WRITE_BYTES_TOOLTIP: Writes bytes on the EEPROM memoery. Depending on the data, the number of bytes written may change.
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_THINGSBOARD_RECONNECT_TOOL: This instruction reconnects to Thingsboard server
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_THINGSBOARD_SETUP_TOOLTIP: This instructions configures a device to receive and publish data on Thingsboard (https://demo.thingsboard.io)
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_THINGSBOARD_RPC_VALUE_TOOL: Returns the value associated with a RPC.
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_THINGSBOARD_RPC_VALUE_WARN: This value is only valid within the code to execute on a RPC.
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_THINGSBOARD_RPC_TOOLTIP: This instructions gets a remote value using RPCs on Thingsboard (https://demo.thingsboard.io)
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_THINGSBOARD_RPC_ITEM_TOOLT: A Remote Procedure Call (RPC) to get a remote value from a switch or a knob.
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_THINGSBOARD_TELEMETRY_DATA: Stack with items to send to Thingsboard as time-series or attribute data
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_THINGSBOARD_TELEMETRY_TOOL: Time-series data requires a key value associated to the data to represent on a Thingsboard widget panel together with the value to represent.
keys.LANG_CONTROLS_REMOTE_GET_WARNING: This instruction must be used within a getting instruction such as remotely getting values from USB, Bluetooth or WiFi
keys.LANG_BLE_SERVER_TOOLTIP: Sets up a BLE server with a set of services. You can indicate the device name as well as add services and the group of instructions to execute in case of connection or disconnection.
keys.LANG_BLE_SERVICE_TOOLTIP: Creates a service for a BLE device
keys.LANG_BLE_CHARACTERISTIC_TOOLTIP: Creates a characteristic for a BLE service
keys.LANG_BLE_GET_CHARACTERISTIC_VALUE_TOOLTI: Gets the value of a readable/writable characteristic. It returns an array of chars.
keys.LANG_BLE_SET_CHARACTERISTIC_VALUE_TOOLTI: Sets the value of a readable/writable characteristic. It must be a number, string or an array.
keys.LANG_BLE_NOTIFY_CHARACTERISTIC_VALUE_TOO: Notifies the value of a notifying characteristic. It must be a number, string or an array.
keys.LANG_LDR_READ_TOOLTIP: Reads the analog value of a LDR sensor
keys.LANG_LDR_READ_CALIBRATED_TOOLTIP: Reads the luminance in percentage (a number between 0% and 100%). Returns a calibrated value of a LDR sensor.
keys.LANG_LDR_READ_LUX_TOOLTIP: Reads the luminance in lux. Returns a calibrated value of a LDR sensor.
keys.LANG_LDR_MAX_LUX_TOOLTIP: Sets the maximum expected luminance to be considered as 100%
keys.LANG_LDR_MIN_LUX_TOOLTIP: Sets the minimum expected luminance to be considered as 0%
keys.LANG_IR_AVAILABLE_TOOLTIP: Checks if the IR receiver has received a code.
keys.LANG_IR_READ_CODE_TOOLTIP: Returns the last code received on the IR receiver. Use inside the IR available instruction.
keys.LANG_DIMMER_SET_BRIGHTNESS_TOOLTIP: Sets the Brightness of an AC light.
keys.LANG_WIFI_IOT_AMAZON_ECHO_TOOLTIP: Setups the value of digital device (on/off) compatible with Amazon Echo
keys.LANG_PROGRAMMING_INCLUDE_LIBRARY_DESCRIP: Include a specific library header name (without .h).
keys.LANG_PROGRAMMING_INCLUDE_LIBRARY_TOOLTIP: Includes a external library. Useful to create Arduino code for custom parts of your code not considered yet in Facilino. I.e: For SoftwareSerial library use 'SoftwareSerial'
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_OBJECT_METHOD_NO_RETURN_N: Declare object method without return value
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_OBJECT_METHOD_RETURN_NAME: Declare object method with return value
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_OBJECT_TYPE_TOOLTIP: Defines an object that can contain variables and methods (functions and procedures). Useful to work with compact notation.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_VARIABLES_OJBECT_TOOLTIP: Declares an object variable to be used just like a standard variable.
keys.LANG_VARIABLES_METHODS_OBJECT_TOOLTIP: Declares a method inside an object to be called just like a standard procedure or function.
keys.LANG_MOVE_ARM_JOINTS_TOOLTIP: Move meArm robot to a specific joint configuration
keys.LANG_MOVE_ARM_POINT_TOOLTIP: Moves meArm robot to a target point
keys.LANG_MOVE_ARM_LINE_NAME: Move meArm to a point linearly
keys.LANG_MOVE_ARM_LINE_TOOLTIP: Moves meArm robot to a target in a linear movement
keys.LANG_MOVE_ARM_ARC_NAME: Move meArm to a point describing an arc
keys.LANG_MOVE_ARM_ARC_TOOLTIP: Moves meArm robot to a target in a circular movement
